;美国应该建立一个国家联盟来阻止中国实施其“剧本”网络空间和数字政策特使纳撒尼尔·菲克 (Nathaniel Fick) 表示，窃取知识产权以推进人工智能和其他关键技术的发展。

;

;他表示，网络盗窃使中国在几十年来能够建设下一代无线网络同时补贴国内公司，使他们现在可以自己开发具有全球竞争力的产品。

;

;“如果我们允许中国人再次运行它，他们将在云计算中运行它，他们将运行它在人工智能领域，他们将在每个核心战略技术领域运行它，”他周三在哈德逊研究所论坛上表示。 “我们必须建立尽可能最大的联盟。”

;

;中国一再否认美国对其盗窃知识产权的指控。中国驻华盛顿大使馆没有立即回复通过电子邮件对菲克周三的言论发表评论的请求。

;

;菲克没有透露美国是否会寻求建立一个正式的政府小组，但他表示美国应该向“中间对冲国家”阐明其愿景。他还表示，各国开始看到依赖他所谓的不可信网络所带来的国家安全和经济后果。

;

;“他们正在寻找出路，”他说。 “感觉风向有点变了。”

;以色列军方周三在罕见的西部地区击毙了“恐怖组织”的三名成员军方表示，随着那里的暴力升级，本周至少有 13 名巴勒斯坦人和 4 名以色列人死亡，银行无人机发动了袭击。

;

;周三早些时候，一名巴勒斯坦男子在被占领的约旦河西岸村庄被杀，随后军队宣布了此次袭击遭到数百名以色列人的袭击。

;

;根据情报，以色列国防军 (IDF) 人员在杰宁附近的贾拉马镇附近进行了枪击事件后，发现了“一辆可疑车辆内的该组织”。一份军方声明称，袭击发生在约旦河西岸北部。

;

;“在识别出恐怖组织后，一架以色列国防军无人机向该组织开火并挫败了他们，”声明补充说，指的是一架无人机。

;

; >;

;巴勒斯坦情报人士称，这是以色列自 2006 年 8 月以来在约旦河西岸的首次袭击。此前，消息人士称，这是自 2005 年以来的第一次，之后有报道称，两名武装分子在 2006 年的一次袭击中被打死。

;

;杰宁副省长卡迈勒·阿布·鲁布 (Kamal Abu al-Roub) 表示，“里面有三具被肢解的尸体”他说这辆车被导弹击中了。鲁布引用了被派去扑灭车辆大火的消防队员的信息。

;

;随着北京扩大地区接触，巴勒斯坦领导人阿巴斯将访问中国

;

;早些时候，图尔姆斯阿亚的居民表示，以色列定居者参与了对他们村庄的袭击，人数在 200 到 300 人之间，而法新社记者则看到烧焦的房屋、建筑物和救护车疏散的伤员。

;

;在哀悼者举行葬礼几小时后，报复发生了一名在附近针对以色列人的巴勒斯坦枪击事件中丧生的青少年。

;

;“定居者向我们开枪，当警察和以色列军队到达时，他们用橡皮子弹向我们开枪，并发射催泪瓦斯，”居民阿瓦德·阿布·萨姆拉 (Awad Abu Samra)

;

;自 1967 年六日战争以来，以色列一直占领西岸。除被吞并的东耶路撒冷外，该领土目前居住着约 49 万以色列人，他们居住的定居点根据国际法被视为非法。

;

;

;

; p>;

;图尔穆斯·阿亚市长拉菲·阿迪卜 (Lafi Adeeb) 表示，35 所房屋被毁，约 50 辆汽车被烧毁，农田着火。

;

;巴勒斯坦卫生部声明称，一名死者抵达“巴勒斯坦医疗中心”。胸部中弹后离开图尔穆斯阿亚的综合大楼”。

;

;以色列军方表示，在“以色列平民焚烧车辆和属于其的财产”后，安全部队进入图尔穆斯阿亚“以扑灭大火、防止冲突并收集证据”。警方声明称，在保护消防员的同时，以色列警察成为“数十名巴勒斯坦人的暴力目标”。警方称，有人朝他们的方向开了一枪，一名警察“向一名涉嫌向他开枪的暴徒”还击。

;

;“我看到一群戴着面具的人试图向我们投掷石块。 “房子，”来自芝加哥的 18 岁巴勒斯坦裔美国人穆罕默德·扎卡拉亚·阿卜杜拉 (Mohammed Zakaraia Abdulla) 说道。

;

;巴勒斯坦男子将汽车撞向耶路撒冷人群后被枪杀

;

;“我们锁上了所有的门。我们跑下楼。我们躲了起来……祈祷我们能安全出来。”他说，他的一名亲戚在袭击中被枪杀。

;

;骚乱发生后，以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡表示，“所有以色列公民都有义务遵守法律”，“我们不会

;

;暴力事件发生在附近的希洛以色列定居点，17 岁的纳赫曼·莫尔多夫 (Nahman Mordof) 的葬礼之后。

;

;这名少年是被杀的四名以色列人之一周二，巴勒斯坦枪手袭击了伊莱定居点附近的一个加油站，然后被枪杀。

;

;在杰宁，一名巴勒斯坦少女也被埋葬。周一，身着校服的女孩抬着在以色列军队袭击该市时被杀的同学的尸体。

;

;15 岁的萨迪尔·纳格纳吉亚 (Sadil Naghnaghiya) 因以色列长达数小时的入侵期间遭受枪伤而死亡，巴勒斯坦卫生机构内塔尼亚胡办公室周三表示，另有六名巴勒斯坦人在袭击中丧生，其中包括一名 15 岁男孩和一名武装分子。

;

;内塔尼亚胡办公室发表声明称，政府将快速通道扩建埃利定居点，以应对周二针对以色列人的袭击。

;

;加沙伊斯兰圣战组织和以色列同意埃及斡旋的停战协议

;

;“我们对恐怖主义的回应是打击在联合国多次呼吁以色列停止定居点建设后，他说道。

;

;以色列反定居点组织“立即和平”表示，内塔尼亚胡的声明旨在“安抚狂热分子”狂热的定居者”。

;

;美国国务院发言人表示，华盛顿对约旦河西岸暴力事件不断升级“深感担忧”，以色列周三袭击巴勒斯坦村庄的报道“令人不安”。

;

;邻国约旦外交部“以最强烈的措辞谴责以色列定居者对巴勒斯坦被占领土上一些村庄的袭击”。

;

;Sinan al-Majali，该部发言人在一份声明中表示，包括扩建定居点在内的“单方面措施”破坏了和平的基础。

;

;除了图尔穆斯·阿亚之外，周二，巴勒斯坦其他城镇也发生了报复性袭击。

;

;今年迄今为止，与巴以冲突相关的暴力事件激增，已造成至少 174 名巴勒斯坦人、25 名以色列人、一名乌克兰人和一名意大利人死亡。

;

;根据官方来源编制的统计数据包括战斗人员和平民，以及以色列方面的三名阿拉伯少数民族成员。

;新西兰总理克里斯·希普金斯 (Chris Hipkins) 将于年底对中国进行正式访问本月，周四表示，他不同意美国总统乔·拜登关于中国领导人习近平是独裁者的言论。

;

;“不，中国的政府形式是中国人民的事情”，希普金斯告诉记者。

;

;当被记者问到中国人民是否在政府形式上有发言权时，希普金斯说：“如果他们想改变他们的政府体系，那就是一个问题”

;

;希普金斯预计将于 6 月 25 日至 30 日访问中国，率领一个由新西兰一些最大公司组成的贸易代表团。他将会见习主席、总理李强和全国人民代表大会常务委员会委员长赵乐际。

;

;忘掉英国和北美吧——民意调查发现，亚洲对新西兰人来说是最重要的< /h3>;

;在美国高级外交官安东尼·布林肯访问北京以稳定双边关系之后，拜登将习近平称为“独裁者”，中国周三予以反击，称这些言论是荒谬的，是挑衅。

;< p>;拜登还表示，今年早些时候，当一个疑似中国间谍气球在美国领空被吹离航线时，习近平感到非常尴尬，当布林肯周一表示“章节”应该关闭时，他对中国领导人发表了个人评论。

; >;

;目前尚不清楚拜登为何对习近平发表评论。

;

;“当我击落那个装有两辆装满间谍设备的棚车的气球时，习近平感到非常不高兴。”他不知道它在那里，”拜登周二在加利福尼亚州的一次筹款活动上说道。

;

;“这对独裁者来说是一个极大的尴尬。在他们还不知道发生了什么的时候。那不应该去它所在的地方。拜登补充道：“它偏离了轨道。”

;

;拜登还表示，中国“确实存在经济困难。”

;

;他补充说，习近平一直对所谓的“四方”战略安全感到担忧。该集团包括日本、澳大利亚、印度和美国。这位美国总统表示，他此前曾告诉习近平，华盛顿并没有试图用四方机制包围中国。

;

;“他打电话给我，告诉我不要这样做，因为这会让他陷入困境，”拜登说。

;香港的监狱和卫生部门已向执法机构发出手提袋和 T 恤后的警报。 -带有他们标志但并非由他们设计的衬衫在网上疯传。

;

;这些机构表示担心这些产品可能会误导人们，让他们误以为他们是在向精神病院出院的患者提供纪念品。

;

;周四，社交媒体上流传一些带有惩教署标志、印有“小榄精神病治疗中心出院纪念”的袋子和T恤的销售帖子。

;

;有网友留言社交媒体提到最近发生的一起案件，一名有精神疾病史的男子在购物中心刺死了两名妇女。这起可怕的事件引发了人们的呼吁，要求审查精神卫生服务以及精神科中心的患者如何被视为适合出院。

;

;提到假冒产品，一位在线用户讽刺地说：“自从我开始使用这种环保产品以来，上班的时候，同事对我很有礼貌。”

;

;还有人评论道：“地铁、公交车上的人都给我让座，走在街上也有警察跟着，护送我。我觉得香港越来越安全了。”

;

;香港考虑制定社区精神科新规

;

;小榄精神科中心为有精神问题的囚犯和在押人员提供治疗。带有其名字的手提袋在淘宝和Carousell等交易平台上出售，价格从21港元到80港元（10美元）不等。

;

;袋子上印有相同的“放电纪念”字样，但带有该市主要精神病机构青山医院的标志也在网上出售。

;

;最近发生涉及确诊或疑似患有精神问题的个人的事件后，这些产品浮出水面，包括本月早些时候，钻石山荷里活广场发生残酷袭击事件。

;

;周三晚上，管理小榄精神病治疗中心的惩教署和管理青山医院的医院管理局与青山医院保持了距离。产品，称他们从未生产过这些产品或授权使用其标志。

;

;有关部门表示，他们已将案件移交给相关执法机构。

;

;该市的歧视监察机构还平等机会委员会谴责任何针对精神健康患者或康复者的负面评论或行为，包括歧视、诽谤、嘲笑、笑话或冒犯性语言，均属不当行为。

;

;商场袭击引发呼吁洪孔氏将整顿精神卫生服务

;

;发言人警告称：“这些言论无助于公众了解精神疾病，也不利于患者和康复者融入社会。”

;

;监察机构指出，根据《残疾歧视条例》，冒犯或侮辱精神健康患者，或通过公开言论或活动煽动仇恨、严重蔑视或强烈嘲笑他们的言论也可能构成骚扰和诽谤的非法行为

;

;委员会强调精神疾病与暴力之间没有必然联系，并呼吁公众支持精神健康患者融入社会。

;

;香港检讨精神健康“精神分裂症”男子杀死2人后的服务

;

;树仁大学注册心理咨询师余俊扬表示，网上的言论显示，本地对精神疾病患者的歧视仍然存在，包容性较弱。 .

;

;他说，最近，以心理健康患者为中心的讽刺或笑话变得司空见惯，特别是在好莱坞广场事件之后，不必要地给该群体中的人贴上标签和刻板印象。

;

;他指出了制作者有问题的包包可能是模仿事件并利用有问题的评论，例如在流行的在线论坛 LIHKG 上看到的评论。

; Thu, 22 Jun 2023 12:50:02 +0800 South Korea’s ruling party seeks to limit Chinese nationals’ voting, health rightshttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/politics/article/3224949/south-koreas-ruling-party-seeks-limit-chinese-nationals-voting-health-rights?utm_source=rss_feed

;韩国执政党希望阻止居住在该国的中国公民干预政治并滥用医疗保险法，引发人们指责它在紧张局势升级的情况下煽动反华情绪。

;

;韩国总统尹锡烈领导的保守派人民力量党 (PPP) 主席金基贤 (Kim Gi-hyeon) –该党在议会中的席位少于其竞争对手民主党，在周二的一次演讲中告诉议​​员们，韩中关系“应该在互惠原则下重建”。

;

;“我们将努力金说：“限制在韩国的中国居民的投票权。”

;

;在去年的地方选举中，大约有10万居住在韩国的中国人有资格投票，而在中国的韩国人则不被允许投票他说，根本没有投票权。

;

;这些在中国出生的居民大多数都有韩国血统，并持有中国护照。

;

;“在这个国家剥夺外国人投票权是公平的除非他们的祖国给予我们自己的公民同样的权利，”金补充道。

;

;他指出，中国人涉嫌滥用韩国公共医疗保险制度是另一个应根据该原则予以纠正的关键领域

;

;“用人民群众的汗水和心血创建的医保基金，决不能滥用于境外医疗购物。”金说，我们将制止中国人的健康保险欺诈和搭便车行为。

;

;参加国内健康保险的外国人的健康保险覆盖范围小于他们缴纳的保费，导致据卫生部称，从 2018 年到 2021 年，医疗费用为 1.7 万亿韩元（13 亿美元）。

;

;这显然是因为在韩国工作的外国人相对年轻，不需要经常看医生。 .

;

;韩国在太平洋上的“亲美”倾向引发了中国的警惕和警告

;

;但是，当逐个国家进行分析时，就会出现不同的情况。

;

;在同一四年期间，只有中国有 2,844 亿韩元的赤字，这表明他们的保单要求相对高于其他国家。

;

;美国人的顺差为 683 亿韩元，越南为 44.7亿韩元，菲律宾人3160亿韩元。

;

;中国的赤字一直在减少，从2018年的1590亿韩元，到2019年的987亿韩元，2020年的239亿韩元和2021年的109亿韩元，当局将这种减少与大流行期间中国入境人数的减少以及政府收紧对外国人能够受益于国家健康保险的要求联系起来。

;

;截至 2022 年 7 月，每一个注册的雇主成员就有 0.93 名家属

;

;在韩国就业的中国人平均有0.49名家属。

;

;据报道，尹总统上周在主持政府内阁会议时呼吁修改法律法规，使其符合“互惠原则”。

;

;尹总统还表示，韩国人韩联社称，中国大使邢海明警告首尔不要押注北京在超级大国的竞争中被华盛顿击败，对此表示“不满”。

;

;邢海明本月早些时候会见尹恩惠的死敌李在时发表了上述声明。 - 自由派反对党韩国民主党党首明。

;

;为什么中国仍然拒绝恢复与美国的军事对话h3>;

; Thu, 22 Jun 2023 12:20:03 +0800 Titan sub search: experts raised safety concerns about missing deep-sea vessel in 2018https://www.scmp.com/news/world/united-states-canada/article/3224957/titan-sub-search-experts-raised-safety-concerns-about-missing-deep-sea-vessel-2018?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.22 11:24;
;;

;Experts raised safety concerns in 2018 about the submersible vessel that has been missing since Sunday, when it descended with tourists on a deep ocean journey to view the wreckage of the Titanic.

;

;The pilot and four passengers are aboard and the available oxygen on the vehicle has been forecast to run out by Thursday morning EDT (Thursday evening Hong Kong time).

;

;The Titan submersible is a 6.7-metre-long vessel operated by Everett, Washington-based OceanGate Expeditions.

;

;It first made a voyage dive to 4,000 metres (13,100 feet) in December of 2018, according to the company's website, and first dove to the site of the Titanic – about 3,800 metres beneath the Atlantic – in 2021. It planned to make 18 such dives this year.

;

;But some industry experts and a whistle-blowing employee had worried about its safety, expressing concern that OceanGate opted against certifying the Titan through third parties such as the American Bureau of Shipping, a leading classifier of submersibles, or the European group DNV, an independent quality assurance and risk management company that sets standards for the design safety of underwater vehicles.

;

;Will Kohnen, chairman of peer-review group Marine Technology Society's (MTS) committee on manned submersibles, addressed a letter dated March 27, 2018, to OceanGate founder and CEO Stockton Rush, who is piloting the missing vehicle.

;

;As time and air run short, possible outcomes for lost Titanic sub

;

;In the letter, Kohnen expressed what he said were widespread concerns about the Titan, and Kohnen said he later discussed the letter with Rush.

;

;“There was a frank conversation. It was an adult conversation. And we agreed to disagree,” Kohnen told Reuters on Wednesday, regarding his call with Rush.

;

;The issue was not any single design flaw, but that OceanGate chose not to pursue the industry's recognised certification process for the submersible's design, fabrication and testing.

;

;“Our apprehension is that the current experimental approach adopted by OceanGate could result in negative outcomes (from minor to catastrophic) that would have serious consequences for everyone in the industry,” read the letter.

;

;The letter came about after many submersible experts voiced concerns over the Titan during a three-day annual symposium, Kohnen said. He said he asked the MTS board to send the letter on behalf of the entire society, but the board declined.

;

;“I stand by the letter and all the sentiments of our members that were worried,” Kohnen said. “There's no joy in saying, 'Boy, we were hoping this wasn't going to happen'.”

;

;OceanGate, ABS and DNV did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

;

;Kohnen credited OceanGate with notifying passengers about Titan's experimental nature. In November, CBS News aired a report from a journalist who read the waiver he had to sign before going on Titan that identified it as “an experimental submersible vessel that has not been approved or certified by any regulatory body which could result in physical injury, emotional trauma or death”.

;

;Submersibles, unlike boats and other vessels, are largely unregulated, particularly when they operate in international waters, according to The New York Times.

;

;On January 18, 2018, OceanGate employee David Lochridge forwarded to the company's leaders an engineering report he had authored that was critical of OceanGate's research and development process for the Titan, according to lawsuits Lochridge and OceanGate filed against one another that year.

;

;In particular, Lochridge was concerned about the materials used in the hull and a lack of testing performed on the hull to measure its ability to withstand the intense pressures of deep waters.

;

;Boss of missing Titanic submarine once called his industry 'obscenely safe'

;

;The company called a meeting the next day to discuss Lochridge's concerns, according to the lawsuits. At the conclusion of the meeting, Lochridge stated he could not accept OceanGate's design decisions and would not authorise any crewed voyage without further testing.随后他被解雇。

;

;OceanGate 于 2018 年 6 月和 7 月对 Lochridge 提起诉讼，指控他与至少另外两人讨论了机密信息。 Lochridge countersued in August 2018, denying that and claiming that OceanGate's lawsuit was an effort to discourage “whistle-blowers from coming forth with quality control issues and safety concerns that threaten the safety of innocent passengers”.

;

;OceanGate did not respond to requests for comment.洛奇里奇通过他的律师表示，他不予置评。 Kohnen said his letter was not based on Lochridge's complaints.

;

;Rush, the founder of OceanGate, has said safety is “pure waste”.

;

;“I mean if you just want to be safe, don't get out of bed, don't get in your car, don't do anything,” Rush said in a 2022 podcast with CBS reporter David Pogue. “At some point, you're going to take some risk, and it really is a risk-reward question.”

;“High-value” Canadians are being unwittingly recruited online by Chinese intelligence officers to spy for Beijing, Canada's national spy agency said in a rare warning issued on social media.

;

;The latest allegations by the Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) come as the country continues to grapple with numerous reports of Chinese interference in its domestic affairs – claims that Beijing has repeatedly and forcefully denied.

;

;China's foreign affairs ministry has not responded to an inquiry by the South China Morning Post.

;

;In a Twitter thread posted on Tuesday evening, CSIS detailed how Chinese intelligence officers were targeting Canadians both domestically and abroad in a bid to gain access to “confidential, privileged” information.

;

;“They identify people who are actively looking for jobs in strategic sectors or who have high-value credentials,” CSIS said. “Be careful who you connect with on LinkedIn and all other online platforms.”

;

;Through a network of Chinese intelligence “proxies” posing as human resource workers or job recruiters, Canadians are first approached on social media platforms such as LinkedIn, where the conversation is then moved to third-party platforms such as WeChat or WhatsApp, CSIS said.

;

;Canadian Mounties probing China's alleged targeting of lawmaker Michael Chong

;

;Those targeted are then asked to write reports that could contain sensitive information for “consultants” and their “clients” – all of whom are Chinese intelligence officers – in exchange for payment.

;

;“Intelligence officers may or may not reveal their true affiliation in order to preserve targets' plausible deniability,” the agency said.

;

;The warning came just one week after the head of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, the country's national police force, said there were “100 plus” ongoing investigations into suspected foreign interference, although he stopped short of saying how many were connected to China.

;

;Canada has been rocked in recent months by a series of leaked intelligence reports detailing how Beijing allegedly meddled in two previous federal elections in favour of the governing Liberal Party, as well as other reports of since-closed “secret Chinese police stations” operating across the country.

;

;Beijing has maintained that it respects Canada's domestic affairs while calling the allegations “politically driven” and part of a campaign to “smear China”.

;

;Bilateral tensions ran high in May with the tit-for-tat expulsion of diplomats after Canadian authorities accused Toronto-based Chinese diplomat Zhao Wei of helping Chinese intelligence agencies intimidate Conservative lawmaker Michael Chong and his family. Subsequently, Jennifer Lynn Lalonde, who works at the consulate general of Canada in Shanghai, was expelled by China.

;

;China orchestrated campaign against me, says Canada's ex-Conservative leader

;

;Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has continued to face mounting pressure from opposition lawmakers and the public over his handling of the allegations. Earlier this month, a special rapporteur appointed by Trudeau to investigate the allegations announced he would resign amid accusations of partisan bias.

;

;China-Canada relations have been strained since 2018 when Canada arrested Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou at the behest of the United States over fraud allegations and Beijing detained two Canadians – Michael Spavor and Michael Kovrig – on spying charges soon after. All three were released in 2021.

;Time is quickly running out in the search for a missing submersible that lost contact with its mother ship on Sunday as it descended to the wreck of the Titanic with five people aboard.

;

;As an international fleet of surveillance vessels and aircraft forges ahead with ongoing search and rescue efforts, each passing second makes it less likely that the passengers on the Titan will be found alive as their oxygen supply is expected to run out by Thursday morning EDT (Thursday evening Hong Kong time).

;

;Even if the Titan is located in the North Atlantic, it could be nearly impossible to reach if it is stuck on the ocean floor at roughly 3,800 metres (12,500 feet) near the Titanic's wreckage.

;

;The five people on board are pilot Stockton Rush, the CEO of OceanGate, the company leading the expedition; British adventurer Hamish Harding; Shahzada and Suleman Dawood, a father and son from a prominent Pakistani family; and French undersea explorer and Titanic expert Paul-Henry Nargeolet.

;

;

;

;The Titan has built-in safety systems that help it rise to the surface in case of emergency including sandbags and lead pipes that can be released, as well as an inflatable balloon. The system was designed to work even if everyone on board is unconscious.

;

;That would be the best case scenario, but even then there would not necessarily be any survivors, said Lawrence Brennan, a professor at Fordham University's School of Law.

;

;The Titan's hatch cannot be unlocked from the inside, “so they will have to open the hatch and the bolts from the outside and rescue the people in there. That's the best scenario, and I'm not sure it's likely,” said Brennan, a retired US Navy captain who has been involved in investigating and prosecuting cases involving submarine rescue ships.

;

;

;

;If the Titan is stuck on the ocean floor the occupants would eventually run out of oxygen and develop hypothermia from extreme cold, according to experts.

;

;Nargeolet, who has made more than 30 trips to the Titanic's wreckage, explained to the Titanic Channel in a 2019 interview the possible dangers of being trapped in another submersible, called the Nautile, in the deep ocean.

;

;There is enough oxygen for four or five days, but that's no help because it's unlikely help will arrive in that time, he said. The biggest issue at the ocean floor is the water temperature of near freezing.

;

;

;

;Getting stuck in ropes, lines or nets is another possibility.

;

;There's a lot of old fishing rope in the ocean and there is danger of entanglement from the Titanic's ropes or cables, said Greg Stone, a California-based ocean scientist who has been on similar submersibles.

;

;“Buoyant lines will have, if they're attached on both ends, can have a big arc through the water that you're not even aware of,” he said. “I've run through those myself and gotten caught not knowing it was there.”

;

;In that case, the mother ship should have had a remotely operated submersible vehicle with cutters that could descend and cut the lines, Stone said.

;

;Mission pilot Rush was aware of entanglement dangers.

;

;“What I worry about most are things that will stop me from being able to get to the surface – overhangs, fish nets, entanglement hazard,” he said in an interview with CBS News last year, adding that a good pilot can avoid those perils.

;

;

;

;A Canadian military surveillance aircraft detected underwater noises in the area of the Titanic wreck, which might indicate that at least someone is alive on the Titan and trying to signal for help.

;

;“We have to retain hope as part of what we are doing as a human community to find the explorers and bring them to safety,” Joyce Murray, Canada's Minister of Fisheries, Oceans and the Canadian Coast Guard, said Wednesday.

;

;The US Coast Guard said they couldn't say what was making the noises but they are searching the area where they were detected.

;

;The noises are encouraging because submarine crews unable to communicate with the surface are taught to bang on their hull to be detected by sonar.

;

;“It sends a message that you're probably using military techniques to find me and this is how I'm saying it,” said Frank Owen, a submarine search and rescue expert.

;

;The problem in that scenario is finding another vessel that can go deep enough for a rescue.

;

;The best chance to reach the submersible could be to use a remotely operated robot on a fibre optic cable, said Jeff Karson, a professor emeritus of earth and environmental sciences at Syracuse University.

;

;

;

;A breach of the Titan's hull at depth would mean instant death from the heavy pressure in the deep ocean.

;

;The water pressure 3,800 metres below the surface at the site of the Titanic wreck is roughly 400 atmospheres or 6,000 PSI.

;

;“So if there was a pressure failure, it's going to be very fast and it's just going to be over in a second,” Stone said.

;

;CBS News journalist David Pogue said the vessel's two communications systems stopped working about an hour and 45 minutes after the Titan submerged on Sunday.

;

;“There are only two things that could mean.要么他们失去了所有动力，要么船体发生了船体破裂并立即内爆。 Both of those are devastatingly hopeless,” Pogue told the Canadian CBC network on Tuesday.

;

;

;

;Even when there is no hope of any occupants surviving because their oxygen is depleted, recovery of the vessel will be difficult.

;

;One of the problems with locating the submersible could be that debris from the Titanic is spread out over a and some could be as big as the submersible itself, Karson said.

;

;The submersible is essentially “another lump down there,” he said.

;

;If it is on the bottom, what would be needed to retrieve it?

;

;“Things that are not available presently,” said Brennan.

;

;Equipment used for deepwater oil drilling could work, but that equipment likely isn't anywhere near the search site, he said.
